EXTRACTED VALUE: Donâ€™t throw the game into the deep depths of the sea, but throw it into a small pond where you can retrieve it every now and then.
As it stands, it's simply a mindless beat 'em up with a few unlockables and some formulaic gameplay.
Action-combat fans would do better to hold off for the upcoming "Ninja Gaiden 2," or spend 10 bucks on an older DW title.
But it could have been more interesting, had some more personality and been a little less of a headache to play.
It's marred by confusing controls, terrible gameplay, abysmal camera angles and, worst of all, a character I couldn't stand.
As a game though, it's far too uninspiring. [Issue #22, p.88]
